title: Mother scalded toddler with boiling water to punish him for peeing on the floor
text:
Patricia Buchan, 29, reportedly admitted to scalding a three-year-old boy with boiling water in, what prosecutors called, a ‘house of horrors.’ (Picture: Essex County Prosecutors Office)

A mother admitted scalding a three year-old toddler with boiling water to punish him for peeing on the floor.

The Essex County Prosecutor’s office said that Patricia Buchan, 29, recently confessed to scalding the boy, leaving him with second-degree burns on December 4, 2018 in Newark, New Jersey.

Assistant Prosecutor Michael Morris said: ‘This child lived his first three years in a house of horrors. Today’s plea resolves the case without the ordeal of the children having to testify.’

Buchan lived with five other adults in the home who were also arrested for using a belt and their fists to deliver a ‘systematic and coordinated beating’ on the boy in July 2018, according to NJ.com.

The three-year-old boy’s mother, Natacha Smith, 44, was arrested, as well as Patricia Gamarra, 63, Mary Buchan, 56, Bridget Buchan, 25, and Homer Searcy, 40. They were charged with child endangerment and aggravated assault.

In total, six were arrested in the home including Natacha Smith (top left), Patricia Gamarra (top middle), Bridget Buchan (top right), Homer Searcy, (bottom middle) and Mary Buchan (bottom right) (Picture; Essex County Prosecutor’s Office)

After the beating, Buchan reportedly made the boy take his clothes off and get into a bathtub. She then boiled a pot of water on the stove and poured it on the child.

A nurse at the boy’s preschool later alerted police of the abuse after discovering blisters and burns on the boy’s legs, as well as bruises on his face, stomach, and back.

Buchan, who had four children living at the house ranging in age from one to seven, is set to be sentenced on December 6. Investigators said only Smith’s three year old boy had signs of abuse.

All of the children were removed from the apartment and placed in the custody of child services.
